author: Agency Staff
title: Zimplats reports loss in fourth quarter as sales dip | Mining
text:
Platinum. Picture: REUTERS Related articles Implats terminates sale of Marula mine Platinum deficit forecast to drop Impala Platinum’s third-quarter output surges as it recovers from strike In this article JSE-listed companies: Impala Platinum Holdings HARARE — Zimbabwe’s largest platinum producer, Zimplats, swung to a $32.5m loss during the quarter to June compared with a $6.8m profit in the previous quarter on lower sales and weaker metal prices.
Zimplats, which is 87% owned by Impala Platinum Holdings, the world’s second-largest platinum producer, reported a 41% drop in revenue to $65m after its sales of platinum, palladium and rhodium, declined to 68,255 ounces from 104,608 ounces previously.
The company said platinum prices averaged $1,127/oz, 6% lower than the previous quarter.
Production of platinum group metals fell by 32% during the June quarter to 71,084oz after a breakdown at its furnace in May damaged some equipment, the firm said.
The furnace was repaired and has since returned to full production, it added.
Zimplats said it had the equivalent of 52,000oz of platinum group metals in stock at the end of June.
Platinum is the largest mineral export in Zimbabwe, and the southern African nation holds the world’s second-largest reserves of platinum.
Finance Minister Patrick Chinamasa said last week platinum output fell by 6.4% to 5.9 tonnes during the first half of this year due to falling prices.
Reuters
